title: Sight & Sound Theatres, Branson
address: 1001 Shepherd of the Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
review_list:
I have seen Noah's Ark and Jonah. They were exciting and so well put together. The Sight and Sound theater is something like I would imagine a Broadway Play would be like. The special effects are terrific. The fact that they are biblical stories makes these shows even better. The live animals make for some interesting antics. I can't wait...


More  



Jonah was wonderful - the theatre was amazing! The way they captured the ocean throughout the theatre was incredible. The actors are top notch! We loved it and will go to the next show in the series of Bible stories.

We were had the opportunity to see Noah last year. "Noah" had a problem with the real live donkey ( He had a humorous talk with the donkey at one point. It added to the show. The children did an excellent job and were cared for by everyone in the cast. The scene of Noah in the belly of the...


More  



This is the largest and newest theater in Branson, all of the shows that we have attended have been nothing but the greatest and we have been to all of the presentations. . The only problem we have seen is that the seats that are in the back of theater that are the sloped raised type seats have limited leg...


More  



This was an amazing theatre. You feel as if you were in the program. The children all were mesmerized at the music and costumes. Wonderful visit can't wait to make another visit this year...

Attended Jonah and the Whale. Theater was clean, candied nuts were awesome, the show itself was fantastic.

This is an absolutely amazing experience. I had never been to a sight and sound theatre before but I am excited to go back again when the bring Moses to the theatre in 2016. The sets are amazing and the whole production was fantastic. A must see especially for families.

We have seen 4 different productions at this theatre and all have been incredible. The talent alone make the productions so good but add in the sets and costumes and props and these stories come to life all around the audience. These Biblical stories become more than words on a page. We leave with scenes of God's love and grace...


More  



If you are looking for high quality performance similar to what you'd see on Broadway you must visit the Sight & Sound Theatres. It has beautiful scenery, amazing actors, and is all around a very authentic experience. Every member of our party enjoyed the show!
-Pages of Travel

The shows presented at Sight and Sound are of the highest caliber. I compare it to any show on Broadway.

title: College of the Ozarks, Point Lookout
address: One Opportunity Ave, Point Lookout, Branson, MO 65616
review_list:
My husband and I visited Dobbins Dining in the Keeter Center at College of the Ozarks for Sunday brunch. Words cannot do this place justice. The buffet was full of fresh salads, breakfast items, pastries, main dishes, pasta, and countless delicious desserts. The service was impeccable. We felt like we were dining in a five star restaurant.

We had several people tell us when we visit Branson we should have lunch or dinner at The College of the Ozarks. After several visits to Branson, we finally did. The atmosphere at the Keeter Center is really nice. The dinner was very good. The student server was very attentive and we enjoyed talking to him. He was a senior...


More  



Love to have those working at the college answer any questions you may have. College area is kept up with everything including the grounds in perfect condition. Nice gift shop and good food too.

The young people on this campus give me hope for the future. Pleasant, energetic, and hard working. Toured the campus which is lovely and pristine. The museum is packed with interesting exhibits. Allow 2-3 hours to just scratch the surface. In a separate building is a neat display of vintage tractors worth your time. Don't miss a wonderful meal at...


More  



To begin with the dining hall in Keeter Center is the top ranked place to eat in the Branson area and it is very good. Not cheap but well worth it for sure. But the concept of the school itself is what gets one's attention. The students pay no tuition and all must work on campus. Drive through. It is...


More  



We had a wonderful Valentines Day brunch at the Keeter Center. Food was amazing: salads, homemade cheeses and sausage, a seafood station, breakfast foods including made to order omelettes, luncheon fare with homemade pasta made to order, ham, prime rib, pork and chicken all with numerous sides, too many to note. Everything was topped off with a dessert bar that...


More  



This is a unique college in as much as it's Christian based & the students can work for their tuition/college fees!
There are no ethnic minorities who want to create turmoil here, & everyone just gets on with doing the task they have been given & being grateful for getting a 1st class education to better their understanding of life...


More  



Farm to table is what got me to visit here... Love the concept. Great environment, superb food, college-age kids are being taught how to work in a real environment, and the campus is huge! Keeter Center (the restaurant) is the best!

Opportunity abounds at this school. It is a blend of old and new scholastic experiences rolled into one campus. From the Ralph Foster museum and the water powered grist mill to the fabulous Keeter Center, this school is teeming with opportunities for anybody wishing to further their education. Can't wait to go back and see more of this campus.

We had a scrumptious lunch at the Dobyn's Dining Room, and enjoyed it so much that we returned twice during our one-week stay. Elegant room, appealing and inventive menu, attentive service - everything one could ask for when dining. It is also gratifying to know that we are supporting a noble cause - the College of the Ozarks is a...

title: Table Rock Lake, Branson
review_list:
So much fun for the family!!!!! Great lake, Beautiful Hills, and many coves, with tucked away Mom and Pop eating places.

We spent some time walking around the lake. It's just beautiful! Lots of families were doing the same thing on a semi-warm day day in December!

We have been coming to Table Rock Lake for 30 years. While the area has boomed with boat traffic, real estate, and attractions, the lake is the most beautiful and peaceful place to be. Swimming, skiing, fishing or just enjoying the views, this lake has God,s fingerprints everywhere.

Pretty lake, the hatchery is an awesome place and is free. Lots of activities for all ages. The dam is a good place for fishing.

Even if you don't like to go out on the water on the pleasure crafts or rental boats the dam museum is a very interesting 1-2hr free attraction. There is also an old fashioned Mississippi style river/paddle boat that takes you around the lake as well as a marina & beautiful walkways.

We live in Branson and always go camping here. Or we go for a picnic and volleyball. This lake is so beautiful and so many trees, ah what a nice little break from everyday life!

Easy to get to and enjoyed the provided path. The conservatory at the Damn was awesome and I would for sure go back if I had the opportunity!

Clear, deep, full of fish and free to use. A valuable asset for America to be shared by all. The dam site visitor's center is a must see and free!

Has to be one of the best lake that Missouri and the US has to offer! Deep clear water loaded with ton's of Small Mouth, Spotted and Large Mouth Bass and rated one of the top 10 best deep water fishing lakes in the US. Water and clear water during the summer months allows for great boating, tubing, skiing, wake...


More  



This lake is so beautiful. Great stop when you are in the ozark!! You can rent boats from here also. I can't wait to come back!!

This was really a good show. I can't think of any remarkable to say about it - just good, solid entertainment. There's a reason why they've been around for such a long time!

Such talent! This is a must see show in Branson. Something for everyone. They are funny and boy can they play their instruments. Makes you want to get up and shout!!

We had not heard of the Dutton Family prior to coming to Branson and seeing their advertisement. It was an afternoon show and we had the day free. The family does everything from running the concessions out front, ushering, tickets, and even selling the fudge!! Plus, they have the Dutton Inn that they also run right behind the theater. Do not miss this Family Show! Best in Branson! Well worth your time to go see! This Family has so much talent and enthusiasm it just pours off the stage and into your heart! They truly love to entertain you!

Bought our tickets through Gary's Quicktix. Delivered to our resort. Did not have to wait in line to buy tickets. Good value too. We certainly enjoyed this show. Eleven of us went to the Duttons Show in Branson. What a talented family! Their children were also participated. We will be talking about the show for a long time.

marvin shorts rock and roll dreams is one of the best in branson. this is a must show for sax lovers

title: Silver Dollar City, Branson
address: 399 Silver Dollar City Parkway, Branson, MO 65616
review_list:
Silverdollar city is a theme park that we've been to many times with your family when they were younger and still enjoy it now that we are in our 60s.
It's the most family friendly & reasonably priced I have experienced. Taking on the family-friendly values that Branson is famous for, the shows, crafts & activities remind us of the...

This was a really fun company outing that didn't cost us a great deal of money. The park is very big and we couldn't get to all the rides in one day. They had plenty of food and drink stands and you didn't have to walk far for parking. The only downside was that you have to go through a...

SDC is truly a place for all seasons as their multiple festivals make it a different visit depending on the time of year. The Christmas musicals are top-notch and the true meaning of Christmas is emphasized throughout the park. World-fest is my second favorite festival but the Globetrotters were also awesome during the summer season. It is a great, friendly...

Love going to Silver Dollar City! We usually go several times a year. We all love the Fun rides, shopping, staff is very friendly and helpful.

We know that the arts and crafts appeal to more of our older family members. Teens and tweens love the big fast rides. Now the younger children have Fireman's Landing more for their enjoyment. Something for most every age-group and adventure-level.
Don't feel that you need to leave the park to find a variety of foods for lots of palates....

Wear comfortable shoes and have a good time. There are things to do for all ages from rides, shows, eats and people watching. We plan to 3 or three times when we are in Branson and still dont feel like we saw it all. The most beautiful Christmas decorations ever

Silver Dollar City is a great travel destination. The rides are on par with any of the amusement parks that I have been to. It has an old-time feel. Silver Dollar City is a theme park with rides for young and more advanced aged people. Thrill rides, family rides, kids only, shows & shops. 4 different festivals during the year. Crafts, outdoor musical. Area has some hills, motorized cart available. VERY ENJOYABLE PLACE TO VISIT. Over 5 million Christmas lights during Christmas season.

Great adventure on roller coasters with the family and the kids loved making there own hand candles cant wait to take them out again this summer!!

We've been going for years on season passes and it's a wonderful way to spend an adventure filled day with loved ones. Christ filled atmosphere and cordial folks all about. Great food and great fun. Let the kids skip school and go on a weekday. No lines or very little wait at most. Kids love this place!!!

title: Titanic Museum, Branson
review_list:
Visiting the Titanic was very interesting for my family. We have a better understanding of what happened as the ship sank.

Well done museum. It held our interest through-out, even a teenager! Excellent displays. Highly recommend this attraction.

Never would I have expected to learn the details of the history of the titanic, Right down to the popular grand staircase. I recommend this to everyone. DO NOT LEAVE Branson without stopping in.

Visited this attraction once and loved it! My daughter was 13 and she enjoyed it as well. Lots of interesting facts and things to see.

Very interesting & you're given a passport of an actual passenger..you will find out @ the end if you survived or not!

Great place to take your children, grandchildren, loved ones & friends. There is a lot of walking, but it does have mostly gradual ramps. Some stairs. Cute things for all ages to participate in. FUN...FUN...& very unusual facts to see & learn about. You should allow yourself at least two hours to go through everything.

I had an uncle that was on the Titanic at 19 years old and one of the last to get off but he could never tell his story without crying even when he was well into his seventies. It made me also cry watching him try to give me the overview of just what that experience was like for a...


More  



The employees were friendly and knowledgable.
I found it to be expensive.
Ask for the family pack, it will save you $$.
The attraction was ok.
I found the information about the persons on the actual ship very touching.

We have visited nearly every time we are in Branson. It really exceeds expectations. Maybe my expectations were low the fist visit but it has never failed to impress. We have had several elementary school age children with us and they seem to love it, not like, I mean LOVE it! It really is presented well for both adults and...


More  



Their were so many things that I did not know about the ship and the people. This was not what I expected, so I was very glad I went.

title: Stone Hill Winery, Branson
review_list:
Had lots of fun. The guy showing the process was funny. The tour guy was laid back. Definitely worth a trip.

Took the tour/wine tasting with friends and we had a great time. Duane was the tour guide and he was knowledgable and friendly. He really made it a fun day. We also purchased several bottles of wine. I recommend stopping by when in the Branson area!

Informative, fun and great wines! This is a great place for the novice or those who may be a bit more advanced in the limitless options of wines and parings.
There is a great tour of the facility that covers the history of the company, its founding fathers and a fascinating, albeit brief, discussion of the effects of prohibition in...

Stone Hill Winery has been in Branson for many years and it a great way to spend 30 minuets of your day. They offer free tours year round and are kid friendly. I can even remember as a young kid coming here with my parents and getting the sparkling grape juice at the end of the tour. It's still one...


More  



Enjoyed the visit and the wine tasting. The gentleman giving the tasting was very knowledgable and knew exactly what I would love. Walked away with one bottle wish I bought more because we drunk it the same night.

We took the short tour and had a great time learning about wine. We left with several bottles and the prices were very reasonable.

This is across the street from the other winery in town. The Tasting is free. The guides are very knowledgeable about wines. We learned that Missouri was the second largest wine producing state until prohibition. That Hermann is a great place to go to visit many Missouri wineries. The Stone Creek Winery promoted two wines, Norton and Chambourcin wines. Both...

This was our first stop in the Branson area for our romantic weekend getaway. We had thought we would pick up a couple of bottles for our stay in the area. I was anticipating a little more of a winery feel to the store which is the only reason I give it a four instead of a five. The tour...

The tour was very interesting, and the wine tasting was very great! Their gift shop was full of very interesting and fun items that I really wanted to buy and take home! We ended up taking home a case of wine and juice, one of the super soft sweatshirts, and I wanted to get some wine glasses too, with the...

This was a quick informative tour through the buildings. Not all wines are bottled here, but one is. We enjoyed the whole experience. The staff was great and the tasting was fun!

title: Shepherd of the Hills Fish Hatchery, Branson
review_list:
Great layout and awesome feeding tank that u can either be on the inside enjoying the frenzy by viewing from below where the feed is coming from, or u can be up top providing the food. Good displays that will educate and provide some fun. We stop by when we're in town.

Called the hatchery to be sure they were opened. Lady who answered said they were so we were on our way. Arrived in a few minutes as our condo was nearby to find no one there. Called same number several times and got a recording. This was Feb 12th around late morning. Oh well, our TAX dollars at work!

Have been coming to Branson for years and most every visit come by the hatchery. Kids love to see the fish, its just a nice visit. Like the live displayed animals they have. Watched the video this trip of how the trout are bred and raised and released to the lakes. Very interesting to see.

This is one of the best FREE attractions in Branson. Great for both adults and kids. They have several cement ponds with various sizes of trout. All the way from the very small ones up to HUGE ones. Inside the building they have other exhibits that are worth seeing too. Be sure and bring some quarters so you can buy...


More  



This is one of the hidden gems in Branson. It is a fabulous value (it's free!), and it is educational for children and adults. Our daughter, age 6, has been coming here since she was a baby, and she loves seeing the fish and feeding them (Tip: bring a small cup to put the fish food in. It makes it...


More  



We have taken our small grandkids and adult friends to the hatchery. The museum is interesting to all and everyone has fun feeding the fish from small to large. A bonus is the beautiful view of the damn especially when the flood gates are open!

They did a very good job on this tour! We all loved it!! My teens enjoyed the horse back riding. The history behind this is interesting!

This is located just below Table Rock Lake Dam. there are lots of tanks of fish in various stages of growth. There is also a building with displays and information about both the Hatchery and fishing in Missouri

We didn't plan a trip to the fish hatchery,but just kind of got there by accident, so glad we went. Nice little informative place, and everyone enjoyed watching the fish and feeding them. We enjoyed ourselves and would definitely go back againg.

Interesting seeing fish in various stages. An educational and informative place to visit. Pretty location too--just a short walk to see fly fishermen.

We always purchase season tickets. A great value!!! The band, quartet and Shonna are all entertaining and talented. The comedian, James Sibley, is one of the funniest in Branson. A MUST see show!!!

This was worth the price of the tickets (discounted due to off-season) More they type of show my wife would enjoy, but the talent was very good, diverse and enjoyable. The comedy was great.

This was our second trip to see the Pierce Arrow show. It was even better this time. The music is outstanding, and the funny man is really funny. These guys and gal love what they do, and it shows. Don't miss this show if you go to Branson,

title: Marvel Cave, Branson

I have been going to this cave ever since I was a teenager. The cave has changed over the years and it is sad to see how some of it has stopped growing. It is still an amazing cave and a must see.

Fantastic trip to the bottom of the cave. Love the experience and we see something new every time we go. The tour guides keep getting better and better.

Several member of the family went on the tour. I have done it a few times years ago when I was a child and again as a your parent. it is a great experience and the kids love it. Bit tight going in spots but well worth the trouble.

This is a must for us everytime we visit Silver Dollar City. The kids enjoy it and you can always come away learning something new or seeing something you haven't noticed before.

title: Table Rock Dam, Branson
review_list:
Very pretty especially if gates are open. You can sit down to relax and take great pictures with running water. Loved it!

We were there while the dam was doing a near record release so that it was pretty amazing. The water is crystal clear. Most unexpected was the number of gulls flying around.

Because of heavy rains in the Branson area in December all ten flood gates needed to be open to lower the water level in Table Rock Lake. This was an incredible sight. Over 60000 cubic feet of water being released into Lake Taneycomo every second. Finished building this dam in 1959.

This was awesome to see do to all the flooding all the gates were opened. I had been there before and never seen all the gates open before

You don't realize how powerful and big the dam is until you see it! We viewed from a side road in a park and it was fascinating to watch.

This is a free and interesting place to go. You can see how the dam works and what it does. Also there is a fish hatchery there as well. Kids love it as well as adults.

It was spectacular to see the rush of water with all the gates open. Hopefully for the people of Branson this does not repeat it's self in the near future

Had a fun time, seeng and feeding the trout. There is also a small museum that families will enjoy. Excellent view of the dam.

We visited the dam right after the flooding but on an unseasonably warm day, January 1st. It was incredible. There was a light mist spraying off the water that I would imagine feels fabulous during the summer. My son loved it.

I went here just the other day as they had all 10 flood gates open and seeing all the water being released was just breathtaking, If you get the chance to go visit when the gates are open then I highly suggest it

title: Veterans Memorial Museum, Branson

Branson is famous for honoring God and veterans, if you have any interest...

title: Branson's Wild World, Branson
review_list:

This is an amazing attraction. Our kids loved it much and we plan on visiting again soon!! A must see.

We took 3 of our grandchildren last year ages 15, 7,and 5 ,the 15 year enjoyed it more than I thought he would many different variety of animals and they enjoyed the singing dogs

Absolutely wonderful place to visit...my children love animals and this was the perfect place for us. The animals were all very well kept and the staff was nice and very informed about their animals...

title: 165 Scenic Overlook, Hollister
review_list:
Best View of Ozark Mountain Country, right Hwy. 165 this Senic Overlook offers the best views of Branson, Table Rock Dam and the surrounding area. If you stop in summer you head across the roud (watch for traffic) and grab yourself a hand dipped ice cream. 165 Senic Overlook is regular stop for our motorcycle group.

I have stopped here for years and watched Branson grow. There used to be LOTS of trees and very few buildings. It is the opposite now. It is very easy to see the changes here from up there. It is still one of my favorite places but sometimes hard to digest the changes.

The overlook offers a breathtaking view of the dam and Taneycomo Lake. The landscape and hills is what makes the area attractive. The price is right too!

It's only a short drive from Branson over the Table Rock Dam and on to the Scenic Overlook. It offers great views of Lake Taneycomo below and Table Rock Dam/Lake in the distance. While you are out this way be sure and stop at the Dam and Hatchery. All are FREE attractions.

My husband and I went her for our anniversary and it is absolutely gorgeous. We are going back this year.

It was an unexpected stop and surprise. Not to mention the efforts of special people leaving locks for love.

We stop and take in the view every time we are in Branson. We usually go across the road grab an ice cream and take in the views. We have in the past watched the 4th of July fireworks from here but you would need to arrive early not much parking for that.

I've spent many times from 5 min to 1 and a half watching the view from this location at all times of day or night. Very good place to sit and think, or to talk to someone. Very nice. And of course FREE

The overlook has a parking area and a fenced viewing area. You need to mind your step because the viewing area id paved with local stones and is a little uneven. Great photo opt.

Perched high above Lake Taneycomo near it's source at Tablerock Dam, this provides a tremendous overview of much of the area. Tremendous views of the dam and upstream waters frequented by trout fishermen. Beautiful visage of Point Royale across the way where many of the show stars reside. In the distance you can catch glimpses of College of the Ozarks,...

title: Our Lady of the Lake Catholic Church, Branson
review_list:
Tourists place for Sunday worship while in the Branson area, travelers are welcome.Six Million Dollar place of worship with guests in mind.

Our Lady of the Lake provided an excellent opportunity to attend Mass during our recent visit to Branson. The Nativity scene was beautiful and the Mass was a very meaningful experience for our family. Beautiful church and easy to find (just of Hwy76)

We attended both Christmas Mass & Sunday Mass. Different priests each time. Music well done. Seating is very comfortable. I'm guessing it's a newer facility and they graciously asked for donations. (On Christmas they asked how many people were parishioners and it wasn't even 1/4 of the church! We apprecaited their foresight in building such a beautiful house of worship.)

The parishioners have built this large church to accommodate the many visitors that are attracted to the Ozarks. The parishioners are very engaging and curious about where visitors call home. They also have suggestions on favorite venues.

We were thankful to have a Catholic Church nearby to fulfill our holy day obligation during our visit to Branson. We were just sad that it was so sterile - very vanilla, not many statues nor stained glass windows. The tabernacle is also not front and center and the seating is like a big auditorium. Seems there is even an...


More  



We have been coming to Branson for a few years and always worship at Our Lady on the Lake while there. The congregation always make us feel at home and welcome.

Finding a Catholic Church is always a priority when I go out of town; you do not always get a warm greeting, but here at Our Lady you feel like you know everyone as they smile and greet you with warm hellos!

People are friendly to visitors !!!! Ushers get you a seat !!! Coffee & snack after mass .... Helps to have Cassandre singing in church !!!

This is the first time my GPS let me down. Ask someone to draw you a map to find the church. Did a dry run and was routed six miles out of the way. Ushers, very friendly.

This church caters to its visitors, which make up about 3/4 of the congregation each weekend. Masses are convenient on Saturday evening, and 2 on Sunday. Parishioners have established a very welcoming community, where I feel at home each time I visit.

This lady start screaming at us because we took a wrong turn... WOW.. no buffer!!!

title: Greenhouses, College of the Ozarks, Point Lookout
review_list:

No matter what time of the year, I love going into their greenhouses. The flowers and fauna are beautiful to look at from all angles.

This is an interesting stop. Students of the college operate, maintain, manage, sell plants to the public and generally are in charge of the entire organization. I am not into gardening, but the greenhouses on this campus showed some beautiful flowers, herbs and vegetables. All grown by the students. Some are for sale. If you are visiting the campus, be sure to stop in.

Although there was not a washer & dryer in the unit we were supplied with plenty of towels which were brought to our door. Well maintained laundry facilities were nearby. Many activities were available...


More  



The resort was very nice. Unit we stayed in was an older unit but clean and quite sufficient. Staff was great. Check in quick and very pleasant. Our coffee pot was broken and was replaced quickly by a very nice lady. The setting was quiet and an easy, short drive in to Branson's main attractions. Directly across the street was...


More

title: Branson Creek Golf Club, Branson
review_list:
This is a beautiful course and there really are buffalo roaming along the ridge top. It's challenging, but not ridiculously so with nice fairways to offset the bunker and water challenges. The driving range is included and allows as many balls as you want to hit.
But there are some drawbacks for the pricey fees. First, no locker rooms. This...


More  



Because of heavy rain during the last few days the course was cart path only and resulted in a good deal of walking, even if your ball was on the side of the fairway with the cart path. Despite all the rain, the fairways were in very good condition although there was minimum roll. Greens were a little worn, maybe...


More  



This is a very nice slightly overpriced course. The par 4 third hole is STILL under repair and is playing as a very short par 3. Several of the tee boxes were overwatered to the point of being muddy. Many of the holes are beautiful and the elevation changes make this course a fun challenge. I would play this course...


More  



In great condition. Tees, fairways and greens in great shape. Didn't like the course itself. Seems tricked up to some degree. Not sure it is worth $85 to $100.

We had a group of eight guys play this course. We payed the full price of $100. We were then told by the started that one par four was under construction and playing as a par 3. However, there were two par 4 holes that were under construction and playing as 100 yard par 3's. That is not acceptable. Basically...


More  



Name change and owner change. Now called Buffalo Ridge owned by Johnny Morris. A Fazio course with lots of enhancements going on. It is a nice course now but when the enhancements are completed this will be a very special course.

My husband made a special point to play this course again as this is one of his favorite courses in the U.S. Outstanding fairways, good, but flat greens, tee boxes were adequate but showing a lot of stress. Amazing views and a wonderful design. It is my husbands one MUST play when he is in Branson!

First, the name has changed to Buffalo Ridge Springs Golf Course but TripAdvisor didn't see it as an option.
Nestled in the Ozark Mountains, this course has dramatic elevation changes, immaculate fairways and greens, and beautiful scenery.
Grab a twilight tee time and enjoy these amazing views at a bargain price!

If you are a golfer and come to Branson, Mo., Buffalo Ridge Springs Course is a must play. The course has been enhanced tremendously since it was Branson Creek. The course layout is the same, however, the scenery is beautiful. The fairways and greens are in very good shape. The #3 hole, par 4, is having the fairway redone, so...

Local Bass Pro Shops owner recently purchased this course and has been making some beautiful improvements to an already spectacular course. Enjoyed a unique and special experience and would recommend this as a gift to any couple. Was treated like royalty and will definitely return for Valentines. Many other things cost more but won't mean as much as this relaxing time spent together. Will include a visit to this Spa every trip.

Scheduled a 90 minute massage with Mary. She was ready when I arrived early. We talked and decided on the type of massage I wanted, then she got to work. She focused on my problem areas. I had a massage and facial with Jennifer. She is amazing and really knows a lot about skin care. She is the best!

Sharon does the absolute best manicure with shellac polish! Best service ever! The staff was very friendly and very knowledgeable!

I called around noon and was able to get in. I had a great message by Andy and a pedicure by Crystal. Both were knowledgeable and professional. My Garman took me to the old location so watch out for that. They are in a strip mall near a Pizza Hut.

My wife and her sister visited and had pedicures, hair cuts and massage. My wife requires a deep tissue massage and is picky. She said this Massuise was one of the best she has had. They even offered a glass of wine. She said she will definitely return on our next trip.

Referred by the Marriott Willow Ridge Lodge. Booked two massage appointments...pleased with service and will return if I come back to Branson.

Theresa gave me the best deep tissue massage I have ever had had a mani and pedi nice place recommend

Booked one of the Couples Packages. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. Excellent Massage, with Scalp treatment and facial. Definitely would visit again.

Husband and I had separate massages and both agreed they were outstanding. The ambient music and decor was great. A must stop next time.

I had a spa pedicure and eyebrow wax. These ladies stay busy, so you will need to make an appt like they ask, and it may take two days to get it, but worth the wait. AMAZING!!! So relaxing. Couples massage and the girls did an awesome. We were both definitely relaxed afterwards.

My husband and I had a pampering pkg couple's massage for our Anniversary trip in April and it was excellent. They really went out of their way to make sure it was a good experience. We had a massage and a pedicure. It was wonderful. Thanks again City Spatique!!!

title: Escape Code, Branson
review_list:
Everyone in our group of seven adults had a blast! Went back with our kids to try another room and had another great time.

As a local server in Branson, I'm often asked what I recommend doing/seeing while visiting...well I have recently discovered the perfect place to tell everyone about! It's so much fun! This place is so much fun! Very well designed and operated. Puzzles are totally our thing, we absolutely loved it. We'll be back soon!

Escape code was challenging and provided an excellent outing for our group of friends. It was frustratingly fun for our group of 8.

We took out of town guests to Escape Code, on a recommendation from my daughter. It was a blast! We laughed, cooperated, and used our brains a little. We will go back soon for a new experience.

This was one of the funnest things I have done in a long time! I wanted to go do another room as soon as we were finished with the first one. It was definitely worth the money and I would highly recommend this to anyone who loves mysteries. I will definitely be visiting again.

Amazing time. Exciting and challenging. You get to be the detective, you get to find the clues and solve the mystery. You only have 60 minutes. Finding your way in is easy, but can you find your way out...in time?

This was my first Escape experience but it will not be my last. It was a blast. If you enjoy games, puzzles, and solving mysteries you will enjoy it.

My group of five had a great time and we were minutes away from escape, but did not succeed this time. We had so much fun! This was the group's second experience with an escape room and Escape Code was leaps and bounds above our prior experience, which was also very fun.

We went through the 4 brothers room and was out in like 20 minutes. Need to make it more challenging. However the room and theme was set up nicely and staff was very friendly.

Such a great time for everyone, adults and children!!!! They have a great staff, and I am looking forward to going back!!!!

title: Dave's Guide Service, Branson
review_list:
Had an excellent day with family fishing lake Taneycomo. Dave kept us on the productive areas of the lake. He was very patient. Kept are hooks baited, operated the boat so we all could drift fish. We caught are limit, and even had are fish cleaned and bagged. Doesn't get much better than that. Best Christmas ever! Thank you Dave!

Dave is an expert when it comes to fishing and is very patient. We have fished with Dave now on two different trips to Branson and always have a great time and catch fish. See you next year Dave.

Another great trip in the books with Dave's Guide Service. Weather wasn't as good as last year but luckily Captain Dave knows how to catch them even when the conditions aren't perfect! Had a great family fishing trip, highly recommend Dave's Guide Service!

The fishing was poor which is not the fault of the guide but it did not seem that alternative areas or baits were utilized. If one fish species is not being caught then many guides will switch to another species that may be successfully caught.

Dave took my wife and I out trout fishing on Taneycomo. Dave was very professional, very personable, and a great guide. He took really good care of us! We tried bank fishing for trout because we could see many fish. We watched the guides go by in the boats drift fishing and catching fish!! We connected with Dave and had a GREAT trout fishing experience. We have used fishing guides before and Dave is TOP flight!

You want to catch fish? You want a friendly guide with lots of knowledge? You want someone who doesn't complain when you screw up?
Dave is your guy! We had a great trip with him today, we took home our limit, but caught and released twice that many.

We stayed in a unit overlooking Lake Taneycomo and watched many boats drifting past our view and all I could think about was wishing I was in one of them. It was a blast and plenty of room for everyone to cast. great company and I caught my first trout within thirty minutes. And extremely friendly guys.

Went out with Dave with my cousin he caught his first trout and had a blast! Would definitely recommend him for a memorable fishing trip!

Captain Steve is a top notch fishing guide that puts you right on the fish. Very professional and well run operation. We had fun the moment we stepped on the boat and the whole time we were on the water and caught TONS of fish. A great trip that we will never forget. Captain Steve is the BEST!!!!

We had a great time with captain Steve on our first (but not last)fishing trip. He guided us to lots of fish and we easily met our quota for the day. He was knowledgeable and fun and patient with us novices. We would recommend Captain Steve and will definitely be back! Great guy!

Steve did a great job. Took the family on our first trout fishing trip. We had a great time and caught a bunch of trout. If you're in branson and want a successful fishing outing give steve a try. I'll be back.

title: Stone's Guide Service, Branson
review_list:
I've had the opportunity to fish with Phillip Stone on Table Rock, Taneycomo and Bull Shoals lakes in the Branson area over the past few years and very recently...so I thought it was time to give him the highest recommendation. I've just met Phil about six months ago but can tell you he knows the area lakes and will put you on fish, you'll learn some of the tricks of the deep water of Table Rock and Bull Shoals. Give him a call!!

title: White River Kayaking & Outdoors, Branson
review_list:
6 of us rented kayaks. Super organized place, nice equipment. They will also rent you a dry bag for just a couple dollars. The "river" (it's a lake) had a nice current that day, which made the 8 mile trip perfect. It would've been trickier on a calmer day.

Perfect place to unwind and relax on the water for a couple of hours. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I recommend going!

Very friendly and helpful staff. Their equipment was good, and they cared about safety and comfort. For planning just keep in mind to plan enough time. Time is needed to set up and travel to the drop off site and time needed for pick up and return. So probably 3-4 hours for 2 hours on the water.

My wife, my 11 yr old daughter, and I took a 2 hr kayak trip & had a great time.
Outfitter was kind, organized, & fast. Short distance to drop spot and shorter back on the return trip.
Great customer service.

We had a party of five with solo kayak for each. They prepped us with the equipment we needed, got us to the water to set off and arrived quickly when we called for pickup. The day was hot so the cold water in Lake Taneycomo was a welcome relief.

You have to do this with your family friends kids it's so much fun! It's beautiful and great exercising as well! We did five miles down the river! The water was cold but it was perfect! The houses along the river are so pretty! It's just a great time!

The rates on their website are accurate. We kayaked 2 1/2 hours, two of us in our own kayaks, and the bill was $55. They were instructive and patient at the beginning, shuttled us to the dropoff point, and picked us up at the end. Taneycomo is a cold lake, which is awesome in the summer time.
Beginner paddlers are...

I tried to call the above listed number for a price list, nothing but busy for 30 minutes. I don't want to put a rating but this makes me, I mearly want to bring this to the attention of the management.

The staff are great and friendly . They drop you off and pick you up to the lakes. We went on Taneycomo lake. It is like a river with the current from the dam atTable Rock Lake. The current made it a wonderful ride. I would recommend this company in a heartbeat. The price is very reasonable.

Great place to rent a kayak. They take pride in their work. When they saw my sister was visually impaired they asked many questions and gave us extra safety epuipment ( unknown to them she was an experienced kayaker) But the current was strong that day and they were concerned for her safety.

title: Indian Point Marina, Branson

I have eaten here several times for breakfast. Today I took advantage of the lunch menu. The service there has always been impeccable and the prices are great. Under $10 for a meal. Try the Mozzarella Sticks. Fresh, hot, and tasty!

This is the same directions as Silver Dollar City. You just keep going down the road to the lake.( past the parking ) The food is amazing. This was the best eats I had in Branson. Rented a tritoon for a group. Great rates and cheapest gas on the lake. Boats weren't in the best shape, but that is expected for as much use as they get at Table Rock. We rented a wave runner for 2 hours and had a blast! That area of the lake was great and we will rent from there again!

We rented two jet skis for 1 hour. Great fun! The staff at Indian Point Marina were friendly and helpful for our first time experience of using jet skis. Our family of two adults and two teenagers had a BLAST scooted around on Table Rock Lake.

title: Wilderness Chapel, Branson
review_list:
Interesting to check this place out.. well built and very nice. Just go to Silver Dollar City and check it out

In the heart of the Bible Belt is this little chapel at an amusement park that actively practices. Don't interrupt services if you go to the park on Sunday. Great little place for weddings also.

I was so glad that we worshipped here. The sermon was great, the music was so inspirational and personal testimonies like we have not heard in church in a long time ! We had not been to Silver Dollar City before, and we had an enjoyable rest of the day, being entertained.

The chapel is an authentic 1800s church the Herschends had moved to SDC. They have several Sunday services which include hymn singing and a short Biblical message. Each year when we go to Branson, MO, we attend the Wilderness Church. The very small church was an actual log cabin church that was moved into Silver Dollar City from an outlaying community. The Chapel is within SDC. Beautiful log cabin building, services are simple and meaningful.
